RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 7 1/2F Turf CR: 84. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 13, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadv isable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GUITARTUITION PLZZ stalked the leader from the three path, followed that horse around the track until the quarter pole, waited for space to open up on the rail, ducked onto the rail cutting the corner, raced up the rail and challenged for the lead at the eighth pole, battled, got in front and pull away for the the win. THROWIN' SHADE was off mid pack and raced i the two path, launched a bid at the half mile pole, saved ground through the turn, responded to encouragement and closed gaining ground down the stretch, shifted out into the five path and passed another rival, just missed for the win but raced gamely for second. KINGS WAGER was off in mid pack, rated while racing in the four path, was given rein at the half mile pole, responded and picked up the pace, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field in the turn, hit the stretch and no kick. CHIEFWEAVE vied for the lead, took the lead and raced on the rail, willingly showed his stable mate the way until the eighth pole, where he was challenged by an inside rival, battled briefly then gave way. PERFECT TOM was nervous in the gate, had an awkward start, trailed for the better part of the race then passed tired ones late. HALF A BUCK grudgingly stalked the leader from the two path, settled after the first quarter, maintained position until the three eighths pole, then started to fade.

ENTRY.NAME: Throwin' Shade
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, bid 1/2, saved ground, shifted out 5 wide, 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Half a Buck
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, keen 2w, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Chiefweave
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail,

ENTRY.NAME: Guitartuition Plzz
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, shifted into the rail 1/4, led 1/8, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Tom
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, trailed, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Kings Wager
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, rated, gave rein 1/2, bid 3/8, circled, no kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 13, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMOOTH COLLIERY gently took back and stayed behind the rest of the field for the first part of the race, raced in the four and five path, started to gain ground at the half mile marker, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field through the turn, was five wide in the upper stretch, easily caught the early leaders, cleared them in last sixteenth and was flagged with the crop the rest of the way to the wire. DAAHERS BULLY stalked the leader form the four path, bid at the three eighths, was asked to close, and responded well closing down the lane, gained ground with every stride, but could not get to the winner today, but was second best. FAREWELL TIME vied for the lead, took the lead and set the pace while racing in the two and three paths, was surrounded by rivals at the top of the lane, battled in between, shook one, battle with the other a few more strides then gave way. FULL IMPACT vied for the lead, then settled into a stalking position, raced in the two path on the inside of rivals, saved ground, launched a bid at the five sixteenth pole when he clocked the favorite passing on the outside, improved position, engaged in a three way battle at the top of the lane, but did not have enough and tired. BAYOU BEAUX had an awkward start, raced to the inside early, shifted out and was wide in the turn and into the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Bayou Beaux
ENTRY.OWNER: Gillis, Betty J. and Joseph A.
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, rail, wide late

ENTRY.NAME: Full Impact
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, 2w, bid 5-16th, saved ground, battled, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Farewell Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, 2-3w, pace, surrounded 3-16th, battled, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Daahers Bully
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, bid 3/8, closed, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Smooth Colliery
ENTRY.COMMENT: took back, trailed, bid3/8, circled 5w upper, battled, led, drew

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 7 1/2F Turf CR: 70. Maiden Claiming Purse 18000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and sev enty yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SALOMEINTHEHOOP sent for the lead, secured the rail, led comfortably setting the pace to her liking, continued to run into the stretch, was lightly encouraged, then hand ridden late, maintained the lead and her pace through out, breaking her maiden uncontested. MARMO MOON stalked the early front runners from the two path, raced to the inside and saved ground, made up ground through the turn, closed up the rail, had caught the horse running second in the furlong ground, battled to the wire, got her nose in front for second. SHEZA SHINING STAR stalked the early leader as she was asked to rate in the three path, stayed just off the leaders hip until the upper stretch, could not sustain the bid for the win, was caught by a closing inside rival and battled to wire just missing for second. DAISY DE ORO stalked the first two horses while racing four wide, raced in hands, was cued at the three eighths pole, improved position, ran even in the stretch. RONA VISION was off in the middle of the pack, raced on the rail, shuffled back to last, saved ground through the turn, came back in the upper stretch, shuffled out into the five path but to no avail. BODI ODI was off of the pace, raced in the three path, made one run, gained ground and improved position through the turn was in contention but had no stretch rally. CHARMONTE was off slow, raced five wide and showed little. TWISTED BRADE raced in the middle of the field, raced on the outside in the four and five path, circled the field in the turn on the far outside and had no finish. ACCELERATING BABE raced mid pack in between horses in the four path and made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Bodi Odi
ENTRY.OWNER: Simpson Bruce and Simpson Sarah H
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, off pace, bid 3/8, saved ground, no stretch rally

ENTRY.NAME: Salomeinthehoop
ENTRY.OWNER: Salome Robert Joseph and Salome Dana
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, pace, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Twisted Brade
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w-6w, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Rona Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, shuffled back, shifted out late, to no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Charmonte
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed 5w, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Marmo Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, saved ground, rail stretch, battled , up in time, 2n

ENTRY.NAME: Accelerating Babe
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, between, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Sheza Shining Star
ENTRY.OWNER: Bradley Thoroughbreds Laura Leigh Stable Cone Jim Belmar Racing and Breeding LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rated, 3w, chased, battled, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Daisy de Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, in hands, finished flat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUNCH LADY showed early speed, took the lead, raced in the three path, was joined by an inside foe, matched strides, jointly leading and setting the pace together, decided to go on at the three eighths pole and easily drew off showing the way alone on the front end, began to tire deep in the stretch but kept going and held on getting the win. GRAY PEARL was off a step slow, raced in the four path, made one run, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, gained ground, improved position, shifted into the six path in the upper stretch, closed willingly and quickly passed rivals, rolling on momentum and nearing the wire, passed one more rival getting second by a nose. BOLD EXAGGERATION was off in mid pack, raced four wide, bid at the three eighths pole, responded well improving position through the turn, was encouraged in the upper stretch and again responded well, gaining ground, continued to closed in the four path, was at the wire and just missed for second and settled for a game third. LO PROFILE was off slow, raced on the rail, shifted into the five path at the three eighths pole, was five wide in the upper stretch, closed making up ground, but not enough. NEVER WALK ALONE vied for the lead, raced in the two path, joined the leader and matched strides while setting the pace, could not sustain the bid and tired late. JERSEY DOLL was off in mid pack, raced in the two path shifted into the rail but made no impact. NICELY UNIFIED was off mid pack, raced three wide, shuffled back and was no menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Lo Profile
ENTRY.OWNER: Bei Lawrence Parsons-Bei Kathleen Reed III David M Michelle Reed M and Rossi Lee
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed, rail, shifted 5w, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Never Walk Alone
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, matched, set the pace, gave way late

ENTRY.NAME: Lunch Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, led, 3w, matched, drew away, went on for the win

ENTRY.NAME: Gray Pearl
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, 4w, one run bid 3/8, gained ground, close, up

ENTRY.NAME: Nicely Unified
ENTRY.OWNER: Autumn Hill Farms Racing Stables, Inc.
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, shuffled back, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Doll
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w-3w, shifted into rail, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Bold Exaggeration
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, closed, just missed for second

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 5F Turf CR: 91. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOUGH CHARLIE vied for the lead, raced in the two path, showed the way while attending the pace, went wire to wire un contested. HALF OURS N STORMY was off mid pack, raced four wide, improved position in the turn, closed well in the stretch, passed the second flight of horses and kicked on, could not get tot he winner but was second best today. JAKE THE BAND MAN stalked the pace while racing on the rail, saved ground through out, closed well on the rail getting up for third. SATURDAY'S GOLD was off slow, raced in the five path, put in a mild bid late. HEZA PRIORITY missed the break, raced on the rail, was allowed to find their stride, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, advanced quickly along the rail but had too much to do. MUCHO MARVIN was off of the pace early and raced on the rail, smartly saved ground, improved position through the turn, was closing on the rail in the upper stretch, in contention, shifted out six wide finished even. LOUISIANA FLASH stalked the front runners from the three path, maintained that position, was in contention but had no late kick. HOSTILE AFLEET raced from mid pack, maintained the same position through out, ran an even race. GOLD MERRITT vied for the lead, then stalked the leader from the two path, gave way in the furlong ground. SIGN OF WAR raced from mid pack in the three path, but had no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Jake the Band Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, saved ground closed, 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Mucho Marvin
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, saved ground, edged out 6w

ENTRY.NAME: Louisiana Flash
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Heza Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: missed break, one run, rail, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Saturday's Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 5w, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Hostile Afleet
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, maintained position, ran even

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Merritt
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, 2w, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Tough Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, went wire to wire

ENTRY.NAME: Sign of War
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Half Ours N Stormy
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, improved turn, bid 3-16th, closed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 5F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JACKIE MOON raced in the middle of the field, four wide, improved and staked moving into the turn, challenged for the lead, at the three sixteenth pole, drew off for the win. SKIPPA stalked the pace in the two path, saved ground while racing inside, smartly stayed inside through the turn, closed well on the rail, shifted out in the furlong ground, kept closing, getting up for second in the last second. ASTROLOGYSPROTEGE stalked the pace setter from the rail, saved ground racing inside, shifted into the three path in the stretch, was running a solid second but had a fast charging rival closing on a full head of momentum and just missed for second settling for third. FLASH FREDDIE was off of the pace early, raced on the rail and improved position, was moving quickly into the the turn, shifted out five wide entering the upper stretch, but was not enough. INSPECTOR ED was off a step slow, maintained position then made a mild bid late. ETBAUER'S SECRET was off in the middle of the pack, raced three wide but never got involved. CUSTOM CRESCENT vied for the lead, led while racing on the rail, set the pace, then tired. JUDGMENTAL trailed. LIT A SHUCK flashed early speed.

ENTRY.NAME: Astrologysprotege
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, 3 wide, upper, closed, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Flash Freddie
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, improved, shifted 4w, closed,

ENTRY.NAME: Lit a Shuck
ENTRY.COMMENT: flashed early speed

ENTRY.NAME: Skippa
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, saved ground, shifted 4 wide, stretch closed

ENTRY.NAME: Inspector Ed
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, maintained position, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Judgmental
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Custom Crescent
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Jackie Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, stalked, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Etbauer's Secret
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3 wide, was never involved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 1M Turf CR: 88. Allowance Purse 25000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet ).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAZUMA wire to wire. KID SHELLEEN raced off of the pace, improved position, closed well, second best. GOLDBRIDGE stalked the front runner, raced in the three path and tired in the furlong ground. RONIC stalked the leader, raced in the two path and maintained position through out. FIRST CLASS HARLOW raced from the middle of the field, stayed on the rail, was in contention then finished flat in the stretch. MIAMI MOONLIGHT raced from mid pack, raced on the rai, six wide in the stretch but to no avail. PINCH HITTER was off slow, trailed the field early put in a mild bid late. OPTIMAL TRIP off pace, showed little. RIVER RAFT raced in the middle of the field, in between horses and made no impact. GOD'S GOLD was off of the pace and on the rail but was never involved.
